results.title: Successful sound for video
results.creator_credit: ViT, Mik Parsons and Chris Wonsky
results.brief_description: To create a successful video story it is essential that the correct type of sound is used for each shot. This video describes the situations in which both sync sound and non-sync sound should be used. It also discusses the issues surrounding different types of microphones (handheld, gun, personal), Mono and stereo soundtracks, recording non-sync sound (tape recorders, video camera recorder, commercial sound effects recordings), sound levels and distortion (under- and over-modulation) and mixing sounds using equalisers to control relative volumes, tone and the positioning of sound.

results.title: Successful lighting for video
results.creator_credit: ViT, Mik Parsons and Chris Wonsky
results.brief_description: This video emphasises the importance of lighting in successfully portraying the subject of a shot in a video. The areas covered include: contrast; quality; intensity; direction and colour.

results.title: Successful instruction - an illustrated lecture
results.creator_credit: R.H.R. Productions, Ronald H. Riley and T.L. Rich
results.brief_description: A dramatised lecture on instruction intended for those learning to teach. A young officer gives a detailed explanation of the three principles of good instruction - prepare and plan; promote and maintain the desire to learn; and confirm that instruction has been assimilated.

results.title: Successful editing for video
results.creator_credit: ViT, Mik Parsons and Chris Wonsky
results.brief_description: Editors needs to follow the rules of how people percieve what they are watching - a logical sequence of events - so that the story being told makes sense. Successful editing can enhance the power with which a story can be told by establishing the scene of the story, creating visual interest, following the dramatic focus, controlling timing and emphasis and selecting the best material. This video describes the factors which should be taken into consideration when editing a video sequence.

results.title: Successful camerawork for video
results.creator_credit: ViT, Mik Parsons and Chris Wonsky
results.brief_description: This video describes the most important factors to be taken into consideration when using a video camera to record a story. The main areas covered include: focus; aperture; shutter speed; white balance; zoom; movement and framing. Also emphasised is the point that autofocus is not able to adjust correctly for all situations, so it is important to be aware of using the correct lighting for each shot.
results.description: This video describes the most important factors to be taken into consideration when using a video camera to record a story. results.title: Subway [Dubbed]
results.creator_credit: Les Films du Loup, TSF Production, Gaumont-British Instructional, TFI Films, Luc Besson and Francois Ruggieri
results.brief_description: This strange combination of action, comedy, violence and suspense tells the story of a cool rebel on the run, who uses the dark tunnels of the Paris subway as his hideout. There he meets a wide assortment of unusual characters. Stars Christopher Lambert and Isabelle Adjani. The soundtrack has been dubbed into English.

results.title: Suburban living: six solutions
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Ian MacNeill and Richard Gilbert
results.brief_description: A comparison of solutions to the problems of suburban living as found in some of the world’s largest cities - London, Marseille, Rotterdam, Stockholm and Toronto. This film shows housing to delight, amaze, and even provoke. Shown is Marseille’s famous community on stilts, with stores, homes, and playgrounds all within one vertical neighbourhood. Town planners and architects discuss trends and problems.

results.title: Substantial shadows
results.brief_description: An elegant, silent meditation on different light forms as they emerge from and transform different obscure, shadowy environments. A miner’s torch flickers across the walls of a cave, a candle flame flickers in a shadow dance, a bonfire blazes in the darkness, a trail of artificial lights illuminate a kitsch architectural structure. Creating a montage that takes its rhythms from the waxing and waning motions of the different light sources Austrian artist Lisl Ponger proposes a playful and poetic contemplation of light and shadow and their qualities when captured as cinematic images.

results.title: Subsistence agriculture: sago
results.brief_description: Sago is the staple food of people in the New Guinea Lowland, this film shows the sago palm, preparation and storage of sago flour and making of sago jelly. Illustrates the susbistence economy and food habits of people living in tropical rainforests.
